In this retrospective single-centre analysis, patients with relapsed or refractory HL were included who were treated with:

1. gemcitabine: 1,000 mg / m<sup>2</sup> on days 1, 8, and 15
2. methylprednisolone: 1,000 mg daily from day 1 to 5
3. cisplatin: 100 mg / m<sup>2</sup> on day 15

This regimen was given every 28 days (GEM-P).

In this retrospective single-centre analysis, patients with relapsed or refractory HL were included and treated with the following chemicals:

1. gemcitabine: 1,000 mg / m<sup>2</sup> on days 1, 8, and 15
2. methylprednisolone: 1,000 mg daily from day 1 to 5
3. cisplatin: 100 mg / m<sup>2</sup> on day 15

These chemicals were administered every 28 days as part of the GEM-P regimen.
